issues.title: Curl error thrown f or http POST
Possible DoS using firefox profiles
issues.body:
### What are you trying to achieve? (Expected behavior)
Testing for XXE vulnerability in the Firefox extension loading. Should disallow entities

### What do you get instead? (Actual behavior)
Does not disallow entities and processes them

### How could the issue be reproduced? (Steps to reproduce)
To be very honest, I am not 100% sure of the workflow for this vulnerability's scenario (due to lack of knowledge of how to use the software, sorry for any mistakes). Basically when the Firefox profile is being encoded, all of the extensions are being installed using the installExtensions function
https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/blob/139980fb59bb0e48e47a1bc515ee4fb6e6848780/lib/Firefox/FirefoxProfile.php#L201
This extracts the extension's XPI file into a temporary directory and then uses `simplexml_load_file` to load in the XML (in order to extract the version number). If the `install.rdf` file contains a valid XXE payload (like the billion laughs attack https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billion_laughs_attack), this can cause a DoS scenario (and possibly even code execution). 
https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/blob/139980fb59bb0e48e47a1bc515ee4fb6e6848780/lib/Firefox/FirefoxProfile.php#L209

### Remediation
Prior to loading any xml, disable entities ensuring that the above-mentioned attacks will no longer be possible.
`libxml_disable_entity_loader(true);`

### Details

* Php-webdriver version: 1.5.0
* PHP version: 7.2.0
* Selenium server version: 3.8.1
* Operating system: Ubuntu 16.04
* Browser used + version: Firefox

issues.title: Take element screenshot not implemented in php-webdriver
issues.body:
As per spec: https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/webdriver-spec.html#dfn-take-element-screenshot
Take element screenshot is not implemented in php-webdriver. It should use the following endpoint:

GET /session/{session id}/element/{element id}/screenshot

It provides a guide, but I think the method implementation is more efficient in usability.
(guide : https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/wiki/taking-full-screenshot-and-of-an-element)

If you agree with the need for implementation, can I implement it?

issues.title: W3C WebDriver protocol support
issues.body:
This is an issue to plan and track progress of implementing [W3C WebDriver](https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/webdriver-spec.html) protocol into php-webdriver.

Currently, only legacy [JsonWire](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/wiki/JsonWireProtocol) (aka OSS) protocol is supported by php-webdriver. Selenium server 3.x translates the protocol if needed for the remote end (browser). However not everything is translated (like `actions()`), making some of the features not working with remote ends supporting only the W3C protocol (which is currently only GeckoDriver for Firefox 48+).

Also since Selenium 3.5 the translation is disabled by default. While it still could be enabled (by starting the server like `java -jar selenium-server-standalone-3.5.3.jar -enablePassThrough false`) it is only partial and temporary solution.

## The work would require eg.:
- add some more functional tests, to make sure we don't breake the old protocol while doing the necessary refactoring
- prepare handshake to detect whether the remote end is speaking JsonWire or W3C dialect (we need this to support the old browsers etc.)
- define common interface for Json and W3C protocol
- convert current implementation to use this interface
- implement adapter for the W3C protocol
- implement GeckodriverService or something like that to start geckodriver locally
...

## Resources
- [JsonWireProtocol vs. W3C WebDriver](https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/wiki/JsonWireProtocol-vs.-W3C-WebDriver)
- [ProtocolHandshake](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/remote/ProtocolHandshake.java) in java bindings
- [Handshake and capabilities resolving](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/py/selenium/webdriver/remote/webdriver.py#L252) in python bindings

issues.title: UnknownCommandException mouseMoveTo when calling moveToElement()
issues.body:
### What are you trying to achieve? (Expected behavior)
Trigger an hover event by moving mouse to element coordinates.

### What do you get instead? (Actual behavior)
`UnknownCommandException: mouseMoveTo`

### How could the issue be reproduced? (Steps to reproduce)
<!-- Please fill everything relevant - the exact code you use, how you initialize the WebDriver, HTML snippet or URL of the page where you encounter the issue etc. -->

```php
$capabilities = DesiredCapabilities::firefox();
$driver = RemoteWebDriver::create('http://localhost:4444/wd/hub', $capabilities);

$driver->get("https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/");
$element = $driver->findElement(WebdriverBy::id("nav-button-menu"));
$driver->action()->moveToElement($element)->perform();
```

This looks like an old endpoint from the JsonWireProtocol which has been removed in some drivers (eg. IE and geckodriver). I think actions are the way to go now which I thought it was by calling `action()` method. 
IE and Geckodriver don't support the old APIs, so we'll have to implement w3c protocol in order to use latest versions of Selenium server.
Thank's for your help ;)

### Details

* Php-webdriver version: 1.4.1
* Selenium server version: 3.5.1
* InternetExplorerDriver: 3.5.1
* Geckodriver: 0.17.0
* PHP version: 5.6
* Operating system: Windows 10
* Browser used + version: Firefox 52, 56; IE 11

issues.title: Convenience class for checkbox
issues.body:
Similary as we have [WebDriverSelect](https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/blob/community/lib/WebDriverSelect.php) for `<select>`, it may be handy to have also something like WebDriverCheckbox for `<input type="checkbox">` elements with helper methods:
- check
- uncheck
- isChecked

and maybe some more.

issues.title: Support local safaridriver from Safari 10.0
issues.body:
Safari could be started through Selenium Server as remote WebDriver.

Since Safari 10.0 ([see blogpost](https://webkit.org/blog/6900/webdriver-support-in-safari-10/)), however, it could also be started also locally, using binary "safaridriver" (as chrome, opera and geckodriver - see also #344, #342). This is already supported by other selenium language bindings, so we could support it as well.  

It would require creating new classes SafariDriver, SafariDriverService and SafariOptions - see [java bindings](https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/tree/c2a4dabfdf0a29a252c9dd33aa541c06c061a9d4/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/safari) as an example.

commit.message:
Add `CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md`

In the past Facebook didn't promote including a Code of Conduct when creating new projects, and many projects skipped this important document. Let's fix it. :)

**why make this change?:**
Facebook Open Source provides a Code of Conduct statement for all
projects to follow, to promote a welcoming and safe open source community.

Exposing the COC via a separate markdown file is a standard being
promoted by Github via the Community Profile in order to meet their Open
Source Guide's recommended community standards.

As you can see, adding this file will improve [the php-webdriver community profile](https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/community)
checklist and increase the visibility of our COC.

recursively delete temporary directories

rmdir() will only succeed if the target directory is empty.
use a helper function to recursively delete the target directory
contents before using rmdir() on it.

FirefoxProfile: clean up temporary files

during profile setup, some temporary files/folders are
created. these temporary files/folders can grow quite large,
so clean them up after the profile has been constructed to
prevent disk space issues.

pull_requests.title: Test against PHP 7.2
pull_requests.body: With the release of [`PHP 7.2`](http://php.net/archive/2017.php#id2017-11-30-1), would be nice to test Facebook PHP Webdriver against it.

pull_requests.title: FirefoxProfile webextension support
pull_requests.body:
Hello, 

This PR allows devs to install Firefox addons based on the new Webextension API.
Thanks for your work that we're using daily for our project.

Let me know if you have any feedbacks.
Cheers

pull_requests.title: When creating driver from existing session, retrieve capabilities from the browser
pull_requests.body: So the driver instance is in a same state as when new browser is created.

pull_requests.title: Update platform capability to match the w3c spec
pull_requests.body:
According to the [spec](https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/webdriver-spec.html#capabilities), the capability platform has changed : 

>"platformName" 
> Lowercase name of the current platform as a string.

issue_comments.body: hey sorry it looks like we already did this. i'd be happy to take a patch for your fixes to array() or require_source tho.  thanks for helping out!
license is apache.  :) i updated this.  thanks!
why do you have to do the \Exception thing?  is that just part of the syntax when in a namespace? i'm unfamiliar.

Yes - it's part of the namespace syntax. The scope of the whole file is set by the namespace call at the beginning of the file. Since Exception is not defined in the WebDriver namespace, **_throw Exception(...)**_ fails. Instead they need to be fully qualified **_throw \Exception(...)**_.

See http://us3.php.net/manual/en/language.namespaces.rules.php for more information.
hey man. this is tough because we don't use namespaces anywhere in our php code at facebook.  are a lot of open sourcers going to be reticent to adopt this if it's not in it's own namespace?
If you decide against namespacing, could you at least switch to WebDriver_ as the prefix for class names, so it follows the PEAR/ZF naming convention?
so WebDriverElement would become WebDriver_Element, etc?
Right.  Something like https://github.com/CodingNinja/php-webdriver/commit/d16018d75ff691ede344cba53a4a5c348d9bcb9b
thanks.  i'll add these.
what do you mean?

hmm yah by default this should be showing the 'message' portion of this exception, which is unfortunately empty.  :/ firefox should be giving you a decent error message there.

i'm not sure any of that crap you've pasted is really useful.  plus, it's the same stack trace i'm betting you can see in the WebDriver server's logs if you go look there.

the problem is, if we start printing out ALL of this crap on every error, than anybody looking at error logs is going to be overwhelmed with cruft crap.

perhaps this could print out if a verbose=true kinda flag was flipped somewhere? what do you think?

modifier is now obsolete in the latest spec; you can close this issue if you like

in my fork, I'm throwing an exception if an obsolete method is  called.
word i'll remove modifier, any others to remove?
word thanks.  was just going to paste to your thing robocoder  https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/issues/5
looks like most of these are dead.  i'll go thru and remove them.
yes, modifier was the only one
rad. thanks for letting me know about these (and the new methods in https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/issues/4).

yah we could add it as an attribute to be passed around and fetched.  i'll send an update shortly.
thanks for your feedback :) lemme know if i can help with anything else.
so another naming convention at FB is we don't put _'s in our class names. heh.  i'm not sure how to best resolve this. trying my best to not fork our internal fb version from this open source one.

Why would you want to do that?  Open is already a custom defined function, so if there's a reason, maybe we could add it as a specific param?

or we could make curl() public for you to call directly when you have these weird scenarios?
hmm this is really a question for the authors of Selenium server.  it's not actually being thrown by my client code (if i understand you right).

I suppose you're right. If you have any insight, I'd love thoughts or ideas. I'll close the ticket, since it doesn't pertain to the webdriver itself, but more towards Selenium Server.

Awesome work with the php-webdriver so far!

you should definitely open an issue with them so maybe they can help fix it :)

thanks man!

For debugging.  A call to select a frame isn't working and I wanted to see why.  I just used open as an example but maybe it was a bad example.  I wanted to add CURLOPT_VERBOSE but maybe there are other options people want to add?

hey, so i was thinking about this, and i'm hesitant to add any functionality to support this, because while you may find it occasionally useful, each kitchen-sink debugging addition like this ultimately obscures discoverability of the 99% of functionality that most people care about.  if you have dug into the code to the point of wanting to test your frame() call and manipulate the curl options, then i think it's better to just have you add that code manually as you did, or even create a fork with that feature if you find it useful, but my current inclination is to keep the client "very thin" and minimal as the readme espouses.  ;o)

let me know what you think.  i could be persuaded otherwise :)

Seems totally reasonable, though I'm tempted in one way of looking at it to remove the $extra_opts argument to WebDriverBase::curl if no one uses it.

What would be perhaps more useful is to be able to set a variable to a path and have all the curl verbose info go there.  So instead of providing a general way to set curl options, there would be a specific way to tell WebDriver to set CURLOPT_VERBOSE and CURLOPT_STDERR (or whatever the combo of options actually is) and all the users of WebDriver would have to do is set a variable?

Could just be idle thoughts.  It might be useful enough though.  Seems like selenium is enough of a moving target these days that I spend more time debugging it or dealing with unpredictable / changing results than I do writing new tests (or new code for that matter).
yeah a verbose=true sort of flag.
$extra_opts is used internally by the framework :) so it's needed.

Hey man, thanks for your interest and for your help on these things.  As far as issues like tabs over spaces, underscores in class names, or different folder configuration, that seems a bit nitpicky imho and not valid reasons to hinder communal/aggregate efforts by causing forks.  The code is currently following the standards at FB.  I'm not familiar with the pear/zf thing (is there a link to these standards docs?) but we could maintain a clean branch between the two which only differed by those classnames/namespaces if you wanted.

On the other things:  if you have other functional changes which you think are wins (what's "fixed key typing support" or "general clean up?") could you break up the changes you think should be merged back into cohesive units and submit them as patches?  I haven't actually received any requests for patches of any changes back, unless I've missed or forgotten about them?  I'm not opposed to incorporating functionally useful additions.
they must pass some additional params ?  i don't see any actual issue with the client itself here.

can you provide a link to the JSON protocol documentation of exactly what html REST requests you'd like to make?  the client is just a proxy for making rest calls.   it doesn't have any specific code for each browser.  my guess is htmlunit requires some additional 'desiredCapabilities' to be passed when creating a new session as described here:  http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/JsonWireProtocol#/session  ,  the java library might have code predefined to add capabiities for the 'htmlunit' case, whereas my client does not try to hard-code the definitions for each browser, it expects you to pass them directly, for which you'll just have to refer to the java code or the selenium protocol.  if you have any more questions specifically about how my client works (and the README doesn't address it), lemme know :)

the readme seems pretty comprehensive for things like element()... the only thing you should need beside my client is the Selenium standalone jar file provided here http://code.google.com/p/selenium/downloads/list .  nothing else.  all my client does is provide a way to call everything defined in the WebDriver protocol proper defined here  http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/JsonWireProtocol

i think you may be confused, because my driver for phpunit selenium was for selenium 1.0, whereas this client is for WebDriver/Selenium 2.0.  they are not meant to be compatible. that's old.  ;o)

do you have any specifics on what's hard to translate to the JsonWireProtocol?  I thought I described it in detail pretty well in the readme, and then provided examples.  what more would you add to the readme to explain it? as far as your element() examples go, they are also just passing those values to the server over the protocol properly, so if it's throwing exceptions, i don't think it's any fault of the clients.  

the other clients are just confusing you with their piles of abstractions.  don't be seduced by which you get to pop up a browser first.  start with the protocol itself and work backwards with the readme.  the protocol lets you actually see EVERYTHING available.  the other clients don't support the entire thing, because they try to hardcode every method call.

i will add something about just getting the standalone server.  thanks.
i just updated the docs with some more info on how to get set up.  lemme know if you have some specific ideas on more doc info that's lacking/confusing?

any more thoughts here?  i'd be happy to merge back anything that should be part of the main client.  looking over robocoders fork, what i found was either changes of convention which are unfortunate because they fork our efforts unnecessarily over a rather trivial issue, and additions such as the constantization of things, which are not something i want in the core client, because the more we hardcode the protocol directly into the client, the more likely the client falls out of sync with the protocol which in my opinion causes more confusion than just passing the strings directly.

if there are other things i'm missing tho, would definitely love to merge them back.

still haven't actually seen any docs about this supposed PEAR/ZF naming convention? is that officially defined somewhere?  gonna close this for now.  please reopen if you have that doc and i can try to set up a branch with those changes so that we match what PEAR wants.

Class/file conventions is a matter of taste. I really like robocoder's approach and so I adapted his code, because this is more consistent to the other code I'm using and at the end cleaner.

Regarding the constants. I understand that you don't want your library bound to specifics of the current api, but those values are hardcoded anyways. I only moved to into constants (because this is what they actually are) making it much more conviniert for developer working with the code (using a proper IDE).

it's not that those values won't change (altho i still think they might), but that others will be added, and then the confusion comes from looking at the code and not understanding why some constants aren't available and whether they are supported, etc.  having the constants still causes you to potentially be out of date.  but in any case, my real question was whether there were other changes that we should merge back.  please keep me in the loop on those.

can you show me how to actually distribute it thru PEAR after your patch?

Yes,

because the package.xml is really hard to maintain, and till now, no such reliable PEAR tool for this.

by using Onion, we can generate the package.xml for PEAR installer very easily, through a 5~8 lines config file, then people can install it through Facebook's PEAR channel or install from command-line directly.

```
 $ vim package.ini
 $ onion.phar build 
 $ pear install -f package.xml
```

or 

```
 $ pear install facebook/WebDriver
```

To use WebDriver in one project as a dependency, can use Onion's bundle feature, for example:
1. define package.ini
2. run `onion.phar bundle`
3. WebDriver will be installed into the path `vendor/pear`.

To release this package on PEAR channel, can use Prium (PEAR channel builder)
1. define pirum pirum.xml (5~10 lines xml)
2. run pirum add package
3. run prium build

Success!

You'd need to zip up the file of interest (to upload), then base64 encode that file to string/text, then pass that as an argument to a call to an undocumented JSONWireProtocol command (see the discussion link), check/parse the returned result for the location of the file on remote server then make a call to "sendKeys" passing the location result as argument. Sorry, but I do not understand your comment and why you close the issue. Can you please explain?

Sure. In this [[page](http://php.net/manual/en/language.oop5.typehinting.php)], there is a line.

```
Type hints can not be used with scalar types such as int or string.
```

We can force parameters to be objects but not scalar. If `int` is used as the type hint, there is an error whenever WebDriverWait is constructed.

```
$wait = new WebDriverWait($driver, 10);
```

```
Catchable fatal error: Argument 2 passed to WebDriverWait::__construct() must
be an instance of int, integer given, called in /path/to/your/file.php on line 12 and
defined in /path/to/php-webdriver/lib/WebDriverWait.php on line 29
```

OK, now I understand. You are thinking that my pull request is adding the type hint. No, I'm removing the hint.

In you repository you have the type hint: https://github.com/facebook/php-webdriver/blob/master/lib/WebDriverWait.php#L29

`WebDriverWait::until()` accepts closure function. Why we need a `WebDriverExpectedCondition::custom()`?

I didn't know about `WebDriverWait::until()` to be perfectly honest. After reviewing them they're functionally the same.

`WebDriverExpecedCondition::custom()` does still allow the creation of custom WebDriverExpectedCondition objects without compromising the protected constructor. It's not necessary as it's just an extra layer for the user (ie. passing the closure into the expected condition into until instead of just passing the closure to until) but it allows programmers to achieve greater consistency, and apply DDD concepts to their code (everything passed into until is the same object).

There is a problem here.
If an extra option was set in the previous command, the option will be set in all commands after that.
If I set the timeout of the previous request to be 10s, all requests will have timeout 10s after that.

If the HttpCommandExecutor is not created by `RemoteWebDriver::create`, for example, by `RemoteWebDriver:: createBySessionID` or other constructor methods. The curl won't set correctly.

I would suggest using lazy initialization for `HttpCommandExecutor::$curl`.

+    /**
+     * @var string
+     */
+    protected $url;
+    /**
+     * @var string
+     */
+    protected $sessionID;
+    /**
+     * @var resource
+     */
+    protected $curl;
+
+    /**
+     * @param string $url
+     */
+    public function __construct($url = 'http://localhost:4444/wd/hub')
+    {
+        $this->url = $url;
+        $this->curl = curl_init();
+        curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT_MS, 300000);
+        curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
+        curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
+        curl_setopt(
+            $this->curl,
+            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER,
+            array('Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8', 'Accept: application/json')
+        );
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Set connection timeout in ms.
+     *
+     * @param int $timeout
+     */
+    public function setTimeout($timeout)
+    {
+        curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT_MS, $timeout);
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * @param string $sessionID
+     */
+    public function setSessionID($sessionID)
+    {
+        $this->sessionID = $sessionID;
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * @param $command
+     * @param array $params
+     *
+     * @throws InvalidArgumentException
+     * @throws BadMethodCallException
+     * @return WebDriverResponse
+     */
+    public function execute($command, array $params = array())
+    {
+        if (empty($this->commands[$command])) {
+            throw new InvalidArgumentException(sprintf('Command %s is unknown.', $command));
+        }
+        reset($this->commands[$command]);
+        list($method, $url) = each($this->commands[$command]);
+        $url = str_replace(':sessionId', $this->sessionID, $url);
+        foreach ($params as $name => $value) {
+            if ($name[0] === ':') {
+                $url = str_replace($name, $value, $url);
+                if ($method !== 'POST') {
+                    unset($params[$name]);
+                }
+            }
+        }
+        if (!empty($params) && $method !== 'POST') {
+            throw new BadMethodCallException(sprintf(
+                'The http method called for %s is %s but it has to be POST' .
+                ' if you want to pass the JSON params %s',
+                $url,
+                $method,
+                json_encode($params)
+            ));
+        }
+        curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
+
+        if ($method === 'GET') {
+            curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_HTTPGET, true);
+        } elseif ($method === 'POST') {
+            curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_POST, true);
+            if ($params && is_array($params)) {
+                curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($params));
+            }
+        } elseif ($method == 'DELETE') {
+            curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'DELETE');
+        }
+
+        $raw_results = trim(curl_exec($this->curl));
+
+        if ($error = curl_error($this->curl)) {
+            $msg = sprintf(
+                'Curl error thrown for http %s to %s',
+                $method,
+                $url
+            );
+            if ($params && is_array($params)) {
+                $msg .= sprintf(' with params: %s', json_encode($params));
+            }
+            WebDriverException::throwException(-1, $msg . "\n\n" . $error, array());
+        }
+
+        curl_setopt($this->curl, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, null);
review_comments.body: While merging/testing it, the curl options resetting does not work when the commands are switching between different http methods, like `POST`, `GET` and `DELETE`.

What is the problem of using `user.js`? 
According to mozilla (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Preferences/A_brief_guide_to_Mozilla_preferences), 

```
In the profile directory are two user pref files: prefs.js and user.js.  prefs.js is automatically generated by the application and should not be edited manually, whereas user.js is an optional file the user can create to override preferences initialized by other preferences files.
```

It looks more correct to use `user.js`. Also, the official Java binding is also using `user.js`.
See https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium/blob/master/java/client/src/org/openqa/selenium/firefox/FirefoxProfile.java

The comment is not correct.
Also, would you mind fixing the indentation? I am trying to get a Windows image to test it.
This is incorrect because the `$timeout_in_ms` here is for connection merely. I will remove it when merging the pull request.
